quoteLast: I was ringing the bell at 200, Carlton House Terrace, Lady Merrenden’s House--with a strange feeling of excitement and interest. Of course it must have been because once she had been engaged to papa.
title: The Vicissitudes of Evangeline
author: Glyn, Elinor, 1864-1943

quoteFirst: And the whole house seemed resounding with his shouts. When it was ten or
quoteLast: the deacon would come in; he was a lanky young man of twenty-two, with long hair, with no beard and a hardly perceptible moustache. Going into the drawing-room, he crossed himself before the ikon, smiled, and held out his hand to Von Koren.
title: Project Gutenberg Compilation of Short Stories by Chekhov
author: Chekhov, Anton Pavlovich, 1860-1904; Widger, David, 1932-2021? [Editor]

quoteFirst: This meteorite fell in the small hours of the morning on September 21, 1949. Not many people saw the fireball that accompanied its descent because of the early hour (
quoteLast: ), but one of the few persons who happened to be outside said that it resembled a huge rocket as it flashed across the sky. He also reported that the appearance of the fireball nearly frightened the swans in the local park to death, the birds fleeing in all directions.
title: Space Nomads: Meteorites in Sky, Field, and Laboratory
author: LaPaz, Lincoln, 1897-1985; LaPaz, Jean

quoteLast: the people were to be pressed back all along the line, for when the word was given the contesting air craft would require a certain space in which to flash over the field before taking wings and soaring aloft.
title: The Bird boys
author: Langworthy, John Luther; Lawrence, C. H. [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: The weird ghostliness of the old place and its many historic traditions caused me, I suppose, some misgivings, for I found myself thinking of burglars and of midnight visitants.  Again I strained my ears.  Perhaps, after all, it was only a servant!  Yet, when I glanced at my watch, and found it to be
quoteLast: , the suggestion that the servants had not retired was at once negatived.
title: As We Forgive Them
author: Le Queux, William, 1864-1927

quoteFirst: What it must have been like for the Companies out in the open can only be imagined, but in the Battalion Headquarters’ dugout, with entrance conveniently facing the enemy, the occupants waited, with what philosophy they could, for a shell to intrude and sever their connection with the Third Battle of Ypres. But none came. After some excitement concerning the whereabouts of a platoon, the Battalion was relieved at
quoteLast: on September 24th by two platoons of the 2/6th North Staffordshire Regiment. The survivors tramped through Wieltje to St.
title: The Fourth Battalion, The King's Own (Royal Lancaster Regiment) and the Great War

quoteLast: , and Burke started to his feet.
title: Jack Hinton: The Guardsman

quoteFirst: All these outrages were committed between half-past twelve and
quoteLast: in the morning, and between those hours--and, indeed, from the very moment of Mr Bessel’s first rush from his rooms at half-past nine in the evening--they could trace the deepening violence of his fantastic career. For the last hour, at least from before one, that is, until a quarter to two, he had run amuck through London, eluding with amazing agility every effort to stop or capture him.
title: Tales of the Unexpected
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George), 1866-1946
